pros: Great pay, great people work life balance

review_title: expanding hospital system in an outdoor wonderland
pros: Friendly and supportive coworkers Great Benefits Great patient population Yearly education allowance to advance toward educational goals Gym reimbursement RQI for ongoing BLS cert Best french fries around when fresh out of the fryer in the hospital cafe
cons: Schedule in outpatient setting is not flexible, no option to go from full time to part time or adjust days, will be put in situation where you either meet their needs or find another job somewhere else despite their shortage of medical assistants. Housing in area out of most peoples budget, will likely have to live in Reno or Verdi and commute, although I know they are working to solve this problem but it will take time. Hospital system, especially the outpatient, primary care, and urgent care clinics are going through expansion to meet the needs of the growing patient population so there are some growing pains and increased stessors.

pros: Wages are good because of the area. The actual hospital and Cancer Center are great! Ortho office is the best there is!
cons: Management is the absolute worst. Talk to any employee in the multi-specialty clinics, face to face, and find out for your yourself how truly miserable it is and they are.

pros: Providers and employees are dedicated to providing excellent customer service and the highest quality of care.
cons: Organization struggles to recruit new employees because housing supply is limited and rents/housing cost high.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Truckee, CA
pros: the benefits are great. team works well together
cons: short staffing is tough in all locations

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Truckee, CA
pros: The company treats you like they care.

review_title: Glad to work where I love
pros: Truckee Tahoe location; generally good colleagues
cons: Constant support staff turnover due to low wages

pros: A job to go to when you need money and you need to pay for food and gas. Why is the world like this.
cons: Everything you can imagine and more! You wildest dream and nightmares! So bad I had problems sleeping and staying healthy

pros: They are good to the employees with salary and benefits. They also have a gainsharing event yearly that's nice
cons: The leadership lacks direction. Some are allowed to treat employees with distain and get away with it. They really need to up their game when it comes to direction, because having a reputation as a snake pit, will not go far

pros: Management and leadership provide lots of encouragement and are easily approachable. Co-workers were great and overall positive work environment! Excellent pay and benefits! I LOVED working at TFH.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Incline Village, NV

pros: Great pay, decent benefits and not too busy.  Good variety of exams.  Friendly doctors and caring staff.  Cross training available.
cons: Little chance for advancement.  Many layers of management.  Constant requirement to flex out if you are not one of management's chosen group.  Senior management is in turmoil since our CEO was let go.  Distrust between staff and HR.

review_title: Big employer in a small town
pros: Job security, good benefits, competitive salary
cons: Corporate bureaucracy, no merit pay raises, over abundance of middle management

pros: Great pay/Benefits. opportunities to advance as they often promote from within
cons: Housing is a challenge in Truckee
There is nothing I can say negative about this hospital
